SENT.plain: Elevated T-cell leukemia-1 (TCL1) oncoprotein expression might promote human Burkitt lymphoma (BL) because increased TCL1 causes Burkitt-like lymphomas in TCL1 transgenic mice
Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) infection has been implicated as a cause of increased TCL1 expression in multiple BL cell lines, suggesting a critical connection between EBV and TCL1-induced BL
The TCL1 expression and EBV status of 14 sporadic pediatric BL cases was determined by immunohistochemical staining for TCL1 and in situ hybridization for EBV-encoded RNA (EBER)
Our results showed TCL1 protein in 11 cases, predominantly in the nucleus with strong-intensity staining
EBER was positive in 4 cases, with 3 of these cases also TCL1+
In the 10 cases that were EBER-, TCL1 was strongly positive in 8
These data indicate that the TCL1 oncoprotein is expressed strongly in most pediatric BL cases
However, persistent EBV is not essential for increased TCL1 expression, although elevated TCL1 and c-MYC coexpression might cooperate in the development of most pediatric and adult BL cases
